Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class Check

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.Check
  • public abstract class Check
extends Object
    Methods for checking preconditions.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Detail

      • that

        public static Check that​(int arg,
                         String argName)
        Returns a Check object that allows you to chain multiple checks on the provided integer without having to repeat the argument name every time. For example: 
         int i = Check.that(numChairs, "numChairs").positive().satisfies(x -> x % 2 == 0).value();
        Parameters:
        arg -
        argName -
        Returns:

      • that

        public static Check that​(String arg,
                         String argName)
        Returns a Check object that allows you to chain multiple checks on the provided String without having to repeat the argument name every time.
        Parameters:
        arg -
        argName -
        Returns:

        argName -
        Returns:

      • that

        public static <T> Check that​(T arg,
                             String argName)
        Returns a Check object that allows you to chain multiple checks on the provided argument without having to repeat the argument name every time.
        Parameters:
        arg -
        argName -
        Returns:

      • that

        public static <T extends Exception> void that​(boolean condition,
                                              Supplier<T> exceptionSupplier)
                                       throws T extends Exception
        Generic check method. Can also be used for other purposes than checking preconditions. Throws the exception supplied by the provided supplier if the provided condition evaluates to false.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of exception thrown if the condition fails
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition to evaluate
        exceptionSupplier - The exception supplier
        Throws:
        T - The exception thrown if the condition fails
        T extends Exception

      • that

        public static <T extends Exception,​U> U that​(boolean condition,
                                                   U result,
                                                   Supplier<T> exceptionSupplier)
                                            throws T extends Exception
        Generic check method. Throws the exception supplied by the provided exception supplier if the provided condition evaluates to false, else returns result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of exception thrown if the condition fails
        U - The type of object returned if the condition is met
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition to evaluate
        result - The object returned if the condition is met
        exceptionSupplier - The exception supplier
        Returns:
        The object supplied by the resultSupplier
        Throws:
        T - The exception thrown if the condition fails
        T extends Exception

      • that

        public static <T extends Exception,​U> U that​(boolean condition,
                                                   Supplier<U> resultSupplier,
                                                   Supplier<T> exceptionSupplier)
                                            throws T extends Exception
        Generic check method. Throws the exception supplied by the provided exception supplier if the provided condition evaluates to false, else returns the result supplied by the result supplier.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of exception thrown if the condition fails
        U - The type of object returned if the condition is met
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition to evaluate
        resultSupplier - The result supplier
        exceptionSupplier - The exception supplier
        Returns:
        The object supplied by the resultSupplier
        Throws:
        T - The exception thrown if the condition fails
        T extends Exception

      • argument

        public static void argument​(boolean condition,
                            String message,
                            Object msgArg,
                            Object... moreMsgArgs)
        Does nothing if the provided condition evaluates to true, else throws an IllegalArgumentException with the provided message and message arguments. The message arguments may be null, in which case they are ignored.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition to be evaluated
        message - The exception message
        msgArg - The 1st String.format message argument
        moreMsgArgs - The remaining String.format message arguments
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the condition evaluates to false

      • noneNull

        public static <T> T noneNull​(T arg,
                             String argName)
        Returns arg if it is not null and, in case of an array or Collection, none of its elements are null. Otherwise this method throws an IllegalArgumentException with the message: ${argName} must not be null or contain null values.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the argument being tested
        Parameters:
        arg - The argument being tested
        argName - The argument name
        Returns:
        See Also:
        ObjectMethods.notNullRecursive(Object)

      • state

        public static void state​(boolean condition,
                         String message)
        Does nothing if the provided condition evaluates to true, else throws an IllegalStateException with the provided message.

      • state

        public static void state​(boolean condition,
                         String message,
                         Object msgArg,
                         Object... moreMsgArgs)
        Does nothing if the provided condition evaluates to true, else throws an IllegalStateException with the provided message and message arguments. msgArg is allowed to be null, in which case it is ignored as a message argument.
        Parameters:
        condition -
        message - The exception message
        msgArg - The 1st String.format message argument
        moreMsgArgs - The remaining String.format message arguments
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the condition evaluates to false

      • value

        public <U> U value()
        Returns the argument being tested. To be used as the last call after a chain of checks. For example: 
         Integer i = Check.that(counter, "counter").notNull().notNegative().value();
        Type Parameters:
        U -
        Returns:

      • intValue

        public int intValue()
        Returns the argument being tested as an int. If the argument being tested actually is an int rather than an Integer, this method saves the cost of unboxing incurred by value(). If the argument neither is int nor an Integer this method throws a ClassCastException.
        Returns:
